intro: Benthamia spiraloides, commonly known as the spiral benthamia, is a flowering plant species native to South Africa. It is characterized by its unique spiral arrangement of leaves, which gives it its common name. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, also known as the daisy or sunflower family. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Benthamia spiraloides produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators.
